main event: Ground-radar targets and a light were observed in Salt Lake City, Utah on December 13, 1954.
interesting points: One ground light was visually observed for six minutes., Two ground-radar targets were detected at an altitude of 1000 - 1500 ft., The observation lasted for a total of 15 minutes., The report concluded that the sightings could be attributed to training exercises, balloons, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena., No photographs were included in the report.
sighted object: one ground light and two ground-radar targets
